organization.fullName: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Adapting and Implementing the I-HoME Intervention in Caregivers of Patients With ADRD
identificationModule.officialTitle: Adapting and Implementing the I-HoME Intervention in Caregivers of Patients With ADRD

leadSponsor.name: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to pilot test the adapted Improving Home hospice Management of End-of-life issues through technology (I-HoME) intervention with family caregivers of patients with advanced Alzheimer's Disease and related dementia. Data will be collected regarding intervention feasibility and acceptability.

armGroups.label: Intervention (I-HoME)
armGroups.description: Participants receive video visits with a nurse practitioner for up to six visits every 2 weeks to address symptom management and care needs.

interventions.name: I-HoME
interventions.description: Video visits with a nurse practitioner for up to six visits every 2 weeks to address symptom management and care needs

primaryOutcomes.measure: Feasibility, as measured by the percentage of caregivers who enroll in the study
Feasibility, as measured by the percentage of participants who complete their telehealth visits
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At the end of the intervention or at 12 weeks, whichever is earlier

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in behavioral and psychosocial symptoms of dementia (BPSD) in the patient, as measured by the Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in behavioral and psychosocial symptoms of dementia (BPSD) in the patient, as measured by the Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire. Scale is from 0 to 36, with higher scores indicating more severe BPSD.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in caregiver depression, as measured by Patient Health Questionnaire-8
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in caregiver depression, as measured by Patient Health Questionnaire-8. Scale is from 0 to 24, with higher scores indicating more severe depression.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in caregiver anxiety, as measured by General Anxiety Disorder-7
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in caregiver anxiety, as measured by General Anxiety Disorder-7. Scale is from 0 to 21, with higher scores indicating more severe anxiety.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in caregiver burden, as measured by the Zarit Burden Interview - short version
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in caregiver burden, as measured by the Zarit Burden Interview - short version. Scale is from 0 to 48, with higher scores indicating higher caregiver burden.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in caregiver perception of patient's pain, as measured by the Doloplus 2 Scale behavioral assessment
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in caregiver perception of patient's pain, as measured by the Doloplus 2 Scale behavioral assessment. Scale is from 0 to 30, with higher scores indicating greater pain.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥ 18 years old and \< 100 years
* English speaking
* Providing care to an ADRD patient who is age ≥ 65 years old and \< 105 years who is a stage 7a-f on the Functional Assessment Staging Tool (FAST) scale

Exclusion Criteria:

* Non-English speaking
* \<18 years old or \>100 years old

overallOfficials.name: Veerawat Phongtankuel, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University
